content.description: Crux down low at the start, move up and left then finish to the anchors up right.
content.protection: Top rope open shuts one directional bolt.
content.location: To the right of Dues Servomachina

content.description:
Climb the shallow seam till you can bust a free move.

The branch at the bottom of the route which gave it the the name has been chopped by an unknown assailant. Fear no longer for your rear end.
content.protection: Heads, peckers, one .75/.5 offset and a small grapple hook.
content.location: Far right of "The Crack" on the power line side of the crag.

content.description: Traverse left on gear protected by bolts and rivets. Finish with free moves over the bulge using a beak as pro (10' of free) Two lower outs required.
content.protection: grapple hook, a selection of large and medium beaks, medium copperheads, BLUE TOTEM, rivet hangers.
content.location: Left of the orbiter by 100' look for solo anchor in chimney

content.description: Short route / tall boulder problem. Used to have a couple of lead bolts, which were removed at some point in the late '90s.
content.protection: None.

content.description: Start left of the route "Follow Your Bliss" and head up towards the bat stain. Keep left and around the arete to join up with the route  "Three's company ". Both climbs share the same last few bolts and rappel anchors.
content.protection: TR only. Bolts have been pulled.
content.location: start left of "follow your bliss" and thin climbing takes you around the bulge and into the much easier finish of 3's

content.description: Late Afternoon shade. Kind of a boulder problem, so obviously I like it a lot.
content.protection: 4 bolts to 2 chains or better yet a sea of foam.
content.location: around the corner from follow your bliss

content.description: This route starts with the same bouldery move as “3’s Company” . A little run out from the first bolt on “3’s” to the first independent bolt on this route, and a fair way from the last bolt to the anchor. Easy ground but don’t fall.
content.protection: 4 bolts to chain
content.location: Immediately left of “3’s Company”.

content.description:
Squirm! Climb an obvious off-width crack via chicken wings, knee scums and burly squirming. One could classify this climb as “burl-fest” aka a festival of burliness. Crux is probably pulling into the crack for the start and/or the last 10 feet of the crack.

*Could be led if one has the proper rack,   #4-6 at least*
content.protection:
Anchor: one bolt with a hanger and one large hanger-less button head bolt (bring a wired nut or rivet hanger)

The anchor is on top of “Daddy-O”
content.location: Obvious off-width crack to the right of Push the Button Frank

content.description:
Slightly steeper and looser than "A Whole New Day."  Also more fun.

The left-hand of 2 bolted routes.
content.protection: 3 bolts.  2 bolt anchor with open shuts.

content.description: Slab with morning shade. Kinda chossy.
content.protection: TR or lead with 4 quickdraws. Chains to clip at the top.
content.location: Prominent slab visable from the walk in. Immediately across from ''Manos, Hands of Fate''

content.description:
Early Afternoon Shade, great for the mind.

Gaining the ledge via a direct route instead of from the left adds a little bit of a spiciness.

TR (because I am a scummy boulderer, Alex loves leading this).

Joyful route and my first introduction to MST climbing.
content.protection: First bolt is a bit run out, use a nut or tied webbing to protect the first moves to the ledge. Two bolts to bolt anchor
content.location:
Walk up and around the North corner of the crag. Not too far from Racket Girls and Torgo.

There is a bit of good bouldering in the area as well.

content.description: Overhanging route at the start that kicks to off vertical on loose rock. Old project of Josh Ray and myself that we never finished. All the hangers are missing. Do it Stu
content.protection: Two lead bolts ( w/o hangers ) Two anchor bolts also hanger less. Optional pink tri cam down low but it wouldn’t save you from much..
content.location: Seen just left of "push the button frank".

content.description: No section is terribly difficult and you can scramble up pretty much in any direction. There are "crack" systems you can follow that give you general route direction. Many one move wonder variations exist that can really get your heart pumping. There also is a handful of obscure aid lines on the wall, use caution when clipping fixed gear. Also be cautious of loose blocks EVERYWHERE, watch where you place gear or step. Could use a second round of gardening... no poison oak!
content.protection: Bring gear from small aliens to #3 Camelots. Several of the variations employ the use of a body belay..
content.location: Seen on your walk in just as you round the bend after the tractor. Its the pile of rocks that looks no good, you're right. Keep walking to Mystery Science Theatre and have a good day of safer sport climbing. Should you decide to give it a look, lots of bush wacking and socks full of stickers is the norm.

content.description: Climb the loose and expanding features till you reach the dirty top and bust of a free move. Then climb another 20' of class 3 to reach the anchor chains. (This is the more challenging part of the climb as you are scrambling on loose boulders and rocks. Recomended to rappel to clean)
content.protection: Set of aliens and a few medium offsets. One BD number 1 cam
content.location: On the left hand side of the Observer formation, quite out of the way for most.

content.description: Gotta be a slim boy to get into to goods. No beer bellies allowed.
content.protection: A good pair of skate shoes.
content.location: Scramble up a ramp of loose rock till you can work your way into the chimney. Squeeze on up to the summit

climbs.name: The Infinity of the Depths of a Man's Mind

content.description:
Really short pumpy moves the entire way up. For being a bolted boulder problem it packs quite a punch. Missing holds might reveal some weird beta on the every changing start.

Can also be led as a bolt ladder. Use cinch hangers on the rivets that make the routes lead bolts look like they would erode to dust.. they just might.
content.protection: Two bolts (run out-ish to the top) and several rivets that make up the C0 bolt ladder. The rivets are way more secure than the original bolts, which are rusted through.. Maybe bring a pad, avoid the DEATH BOLT which is marked with the X.
content.location: Next to Push the Button Frank on the obvious boulder

content.description: Slightly overhanging face climbing up the center of the formation.  Sequential & fun!
content.protection: 3 bolts (just enough to call it a sport route).  2 bolt anchor with chains.

content.description: Loose arete climbing past 3 bolts.
content.protection: 3 bolts.  2 bolts with open shuts.
content.location: Arete around to the left of Racket Girls.

content.description: 4 Bolts up thin stuff. Sustained.
content.protection: Four bolts to two chains.
content.location: Left-most route at MST

content.description: The route begins with the same free moves as Pamela and then traverses left on rivets to the top.
content.protection: Quickdraw's and rivet hangers. The rivets on the far left seem to shock you on a windy day. Use slings as hangers on the last three.
content.location: Start on the same holds as Pamela, free climb to the first bolt. Then from the ledge go left.

content.description:
One of the better routes at MST.

A powerful, dynamic move off of an obvious pocket leads to a glued-on [correction: glue-reinforced] jug.  Above this, the angle of the overhanging wall relents, but the holds get thinner.

Clipping the bolts is strenuous.  Some people reach left to gain larger holds from which to clip.
content.protection: 4 bolts to open shuts.  With a little creativity, it is possible to walk around to the top and establish a TR.

content.description: Thin face climbing all the way up, if you chimney up to the second bolt it takes away a lot of the fun climbing. The crux is the final moves to the anchors, very thought provoking.
content.protection: Three bolts to chains. Can easily walk off after a lead or set up a TR.
content.location: Located in the chimney between "..Depths of a mans mind" and "Comet X" . The arete to the left of the bolted route is “Manos, hands of fate” and is rated somewhere in the 10’s (TR only)

content.description: Climb the obvious crack to the right of Pamela
content.protection: Either solo it, or bring gear to 5". The route shares the same anchors with "The Brain that Wouldn't Die" to the left of it.
content.location: Right of Pamela

content.description: Fun little crack served with crimps on the side. Recommended highball boulder.
content.protection: Bolts and Chains use webbing/cordalette to top rope.
content.location: Left of Torgo, in a new area. Start at the water polished bottom of the crack, follow up right.

content.description: Crux is after the second bolt
content.protection: 2 bolts with a small cam optional before committing to the wall and clipping a "high" first bolt. i brought a green and a blue alien, they both fit.

climbs.name: The Brain that Wouldn't Die
climbs.fa: TR: unknown Lead: Will and Ed

content.description: Old single bolt route or TR. Use boulders to back up the bolt, and wear a helmet.
content.protection:
Bring a long piece of cordelette as the anchor is over the edge a bit.

NOTICE: The anchor bolt up there is a spinner, its been there forever. It appears it was a single bolt TR or rappel.
content.location: just to the left of the Crack.

content.description:
By many accounts, the best route at MST.

Start, down low on the left.  Turn the arete to the right and climb the right side of the arete to a steep face.  Awkward side-pulling marks the pumpy crux of the route at mid-height.
content.protection: 5 bolts.  2 bolt anchor with chains.

content.description: Start up a vertical face on small holds till you get a jug and pull up onto the slab to finish.
content.protection: Two bolt anchor. Bring long chord
content.location: If you’re  facing the main crag, it’s directly behind you on the other band of rocks. Near the cluster of boulders know as the Fraggle Area

climbs.name: Are You Happy in Your Work?

content.description: Top rope up the right-center part of the face.  Slightly overhanging.  Marked by long, fun reaches between positive holds.
content.protection: 3 bolts, chain anchor.  Clip one bolt as a directional to protect against a big swing if TRing.

climbs.name: A Whole New Day o' Rock Climbin'

content.description:
Pumpy face climbing that follows the right-hand of 2 bolted lines.  Starting holds have pulled off rendering the start substantially harder than the original 5.8 rating.

Loose rock abounds on this boulder.  Watch what you pull on.
content.protection:
3 bolts.  2 bolt anchor with open shuts.

Clip directionals in order to top rope.

climbs.name: A Walk On The Wild Side

content.description: Start at the large crack at the base of the eret. After clipping the first bolt move right onto face. The crux is after the second bolt at a horizontal crack. Stay on route or it's very loose.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Just to the right of a larger egg shaped Boulder with a shade hallway. Easy and obvious downclimb.
